body:
There's a comment in the openssl package.py noting that it also requires "make" and "perl".

It needs more than just "perl", it also needs (at least) "Test::More", which some distro's (cough CentOS cough) have teased out of the perl package.

My minimal-oid dev image happens to have `/usr/bin/perl`, but not `Test::More`.  I'm not sure why this has worked in the past, probably because I've had a linuxbrew tree on my path that gave me a more modern perl (Does that make me a package manager traitor?).

Just checking if there's a reason to not add the dependency.

If there's no problem I'll submit a PR.
title: OpenSSL should depends_on("perl", type="build")
